result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario D Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mario D Smith in court.  Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court for Mario D Smith.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mario D Smith in court.  Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court for Mario D Smith.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Court reminded defendant of no contact order and conditions of bail.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mario D Smith in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Elizabeth Rubio, Milwaukee Police Department Detective.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Mario D Smith in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for order to show cause hearing. Defense counsel has been appointed to the case. Court schedules case for preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mario D Smith in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court orders a respresentative from the SPD appear on the next date if an attorney is not appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mario D Smith in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 3 for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/30/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LDD and any of her children.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Mario D Smith in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
